title.narrative: Third Regional Meeting on Development Effectiveness

description.narrative:
Canada’s contribution was used to facilitate logistical arrangements for the meeting organized by the African Union, NEPAD Planning and Coordinating Agency, UNDP and UNECA which took place in Addis Ababa in September 2011. The regional meeting builds on the Pretoria and Tunis meeting which have sought to build consensus among African countries for a “Beyond Aid” agenda by introducing the concept of capacity building in development through such mechanisms as South-South Cooperation and knowledge building. The results of the meeting are captured in the statement by Mr. Ibrahim Mayaki, Chief Executive Officer of NEPAD who is quoted as stating that:
“…for the first time Africa has presented its own vision for aid and the future development of the continent…aid must be used as a catalyst for development, along with innovative use of domestic resources, and the private sector playing a key role…”
At the end of the meeting, African countries came up with seven key priorities for development effectives outlined in a common position in preparation for the 4th high level conference on aid effectiveness which took place in Busan, Korea in November 2011. The meeting succeeded in bringing together about 150 participants representing African countries, organized around ApDEV, African Union’s Platform for Development Effectiveness. Approved: CAD 58,704 (nil disbursed).

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
